sen.j: 割烹着（かっぽうぎ）は、日本で考案された、主に和服にかけるエプロンの一種。
sen.e: Kappogi is a kind of apron originated in Japan and mainly worn over wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).
Kappogi is a kind of apron originated in Japan and mainly worn over wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).
Kappogi is a kind of apron originated in Japan and mainly worn over wafuku (Japanese traditional clothes).

sen.j: 家事労働の際に着物を保護するために考案されたもので、着物の袂が納まる程度の袖幅（袖の太さ）と袖丈（袖の長さ）であり、おおむね身丈は膝まである（着物並みの身丈の割烹着もある）。
sen.e: I was first designed to protect kimono while one was doing the housework, with its sleeve size and a sleeve length being big enough to put the tamoto (sleeve pouch) of kimono in, and with its mitake (length of clothing) generally hanging to the height of the knees (the mitake of some kappogi are as long as kimono.)

It was first designed to protect kimono while one was doing the housework, with its sleeve size and a sleeve length being big enough to put the tamoto (sleeve pouch) of kimono in, and with its mitake (length of clothing) generally hanging to the height of knees (the mitake of some kappogi is as long as kimono.)
sen.cmt: I → Itthe height of the knees →the height of kneesare → is
sen.e: It was first designed to protect kimono while one was doing the housework, with its sleeve size and a sleeve length being big enough to put the tamoto (sleeve pouch) of kimono in, and with its mitake (length of clothing) generally hanging to the height of knees (the mitake of some kappogi is as long as kimono.)

sen.j: 紐は肩のまわりで胸当てのように結ばれる。
sen.e: Its straps are tied around the shoulders like a chest protector.
Its straps are tied around the shoulders like a chest protector.
Its straps are tied around the shoulders like a chest protector.

sen.j: 袖口にゴムを通すこともあり、ポケットがあるものもある。
sen.e: Some of them have wrist openings of the sleeves with rubber strings passed around them, and some of them have pockets.
Some of them have wrist openings of the sleeves with rubber strings passed around them, and some of them have pockets.
Some of them have wrist openings of the sleeves with rubber strings passed around them, and some of them have pockets.

sen.j: 調理や掃除などの際、衛生上の問題や、着物が汚れるのを防ぐために着用する。
sen.e: You wear kappogi to prevent the troubles with hygiene or protect kimono from dirt and stain during cooking or cleaning.
It is used to prevent troubles with hygiene or protect kimono from dirt and stain during cooking or cleaning.
sen.cmt: You wear kappongi →It is usedthe troubles →the 削除
sen.e: It is used to prevent troubles with hygiene or protect kimono from dirt and stain during cooking or cleaning.

sen.j: 着用には襟と腰2箇所にある紐を用いて、背中で結ぶものが多い。
sen.e: When you wear it, you usually use the straps attached to two places, the neck and the waist, and tie them on the back.
To put on kappogi, straps attached to two places, the neck and the waist, are usually tied on the back.
To put on kappogi, straps attached to two places, the neck and the waist, are usually tied on the back.

sen.j: 現在の割烹着の多くは、襟周りが丸くなっている。
sen.e: Most of the present kappogi are cut round around the collar.
Most of the present kappogi are cut round around the collar.
Most of the present kappogi are cut round around the collar.

sen.j: 昭和中期までは襟周りが角ばっているものが主流であったため、現在でもその古めかしいイメージを好む者もいる。
sen.e: But because it was a main current to be cut square around the collar until the mid Showa period, even now some people prefer that old-fashioned image.
Because it was a main current to be cut square around the collar until the mid Showa period, even now some people prefer that old-fashioned image.
Because it was a main current to be cut square around the collar until the mid Showa period, even now some people prefer that old-fashioned image.

tit.e: Japan's National Defense Women's Association and kappogi
Japan's National Defense Women's Association and kappogi
Japan's National Defense Women's Association and kappogi

sen.j: 国防婦人会の会服となった割烹着は、1913年発行の雑誌『婦人之友』に掲載された笹木幸子考案の「家庭用仕事着」であるとされる。
sen.e: The kappogi which was adopted as a uniform of the Japan's National Defense Women's Association is thought to have been "a work clothing for household use" which was designed by Sachiko SASAKI and appeared in the magazine "Fujin no Tomo" (a Japanese magazine for middle-class women in the city) issued in 1913.

The kappogi which was adopted as a uniform of the Japan's National Defense Women's Association is thought to be "work clothes for housework", which was designed by Sachiko SASAKI and introduced in the magazine "Fujin no Tomo" (a Japanese magazine for middle-class women in the city) issued in 1913.

The kappogi adopted as a uniform by the Japan National Defense Women's Association is thought to have been a type of "clothing for household chores" that was invented by Sachiko SASAKI and introduced in an edition of the magazine "Fujin no Tomo" (a Japanese magazine for urban middle-class women) that was published in 1913.
sen.cmt: is →waswork clothes for housework→clothing for household chores

sen.j: その後百貨店などで売り出され一般に普及していった。
sen.e: Then, it was put up for sale in department stores and the like, and was becoming popular in the general public.
Then, it was put up for sale in department stores and the like, and was becoming popular in the general public.
Then, it was put up for sale in department stores and the like, and was becoming popular in the general public.

sen.j: 1932年に成立した国防婦人会は「国防は台所から」というスローガンを掲げ、割烹着に襷掛けという会服で、千人針、出征兵士の見送り、廃品回収による献金、軍人遺族の慰問などの諸活動をおこなった。
sen.e: The Japan's National Defense Women's Association which was organized in 1932 held up "National Defense in the Kitchen" as its slogan, and in the uniform of kappogi and tasuki-gake (tucking up the sleeves of a kimono with a cord), carried out various activities such as sewing senninbari (a cotton belt with a thousand red stitches, which was an amulet to avoid bullets), seeing off soldiers leaving for the front, donating money earned with collection of waste materials, visiting and comforting the soldier's bereaved family, and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The Japan's National Defense Women's Association, which was organized in 1932, held up "National Defense from the Kitchen" as its slogan, and carried out various activities such as sewing senninbari (a cotton belt with a thousand red stitches, which was an amulet to avoid bullets), seeing off soldiers leaving for the front, donating money earned with collection of waste materials, visiting and comforting the soldier's bereaved family, and so on, in the uniform of kappogi and tasuki-gake (tucking up the sleeves of a kimono with a cord).

The Japan's National Defense Women's Association, which was organized in 1932, carried out various activities such as sewing senninbari (a cotton belt with a thousand red stitches, which was an amulet to avoid bullets), seeing off soldiers who were to leave for the front, donating money earned from collecting and selling waste materials, visiting and comforting the soldier's bereaved family, and so on, in the uniform of kappogi and tasuki-gake (tucking up the sleeves of a kimono with a cord) with the slogan "National Defense starts from the Kitchen."
sen.cmt: National Defense from the Kitchen→National Defense starts from the Kitchenearned with collection→earned from collectionsoldiers leaving→soldiers who were to leave

sen.j: その際、この会服は「着物競争」に陥りがちな他の婦人会にくらべ、より広汎な大衆動員を可能にしたといえる。
sen.e: Under these circumstances, it can be said that this uniform enabled it to achieve more widespread mass mobilization than the other Women's Clubs that were apt to be thrown into "the competition of Japanese kimono".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Under these circumstances, it can be said that this uniform enabled it to achieve more widespread mass mobilization than the other Women's Clubs that were apt to be thrown into "the competition of Japanese kimono".

Under these circumstances, it can be said that this uniform enabled it to achieve more widespread mass mobilization than the other Women's Clubs that were apt to be thrown into "the competition of Japanese kimono".

sen.j: 1941年には愛国婦人会と大日本連合婦人会を吸収、統合して大日本婦人会となった。
sen.e: In 1941, the Patriotic Women's Association and the Japan Women's Group Association were absorbed into the Japan's National Defense Women's Association and they were integrated into the Japan Women's Association.

In 1941, the Patriotic Women's Association and the Japan Women's Group Association were absorbed into the Japan's National Defense Women's Association and they were integrated into the Japan Women's Association.

In 1941, the Patriotic Women's Association and the Japan Women's Group Association were absorbed into the Japan's National Defense Women's Association and they were integrated into the Japan Women's Association.

sen.j: しかし、戦況が悪化し本土決戦が近づくと、それにそなえて大日本婦人会は解散、また、急速に物資が欠乏して木綿も入手できなくなったため、婦人の服装ももんぺ姿へと変わっていった。
sen.e: But as the war situation had become worse and the homeland defense war had drawn near, the Japan Women's Association dissolved just in case, and goods were running short rapidly and cotton also became unavailable, so that the costume of the women were changing into the monpe (women's work pants) style, too.

But as the war situation had become worse and the homeland defense war had drawn near, the Japan Women's Association dissolved to prepare for it, while goods were running short rapidly and cotton also became unavailable, accordingly the costume of the women were changing into the monpe (women's work pants) style.

But as the war situation worsened and the homeland defense war drew near, the Japan Women's Association was dissolved to prepare for it, and people began running out of goods rapidly and cotton became impossible to come by; as a result, women began to wear monpe (women's work pants).
sen.cmt: costume of the women→women's costume were changing→changed

sen.j: ここでは一般的に行われている、着物に割烹着をかける手順の一例を示す。
sen.e: This section describes an example of common procedures for putting on kappogi over kimono.
This section describes an example of common procedures for putting on kappogi over kimono.
This section describes an example of common procedures for putting on kappogi over kimono.

sen.j: 襟ヒモを持ち、割烹着掛けから割烹着を外し、襟ヒモを解く。
sen.e: Holding the collar straps, take the kappogi off the hanger for kappogi, and untie the collar straps.
Holding the collar straps, take the kappogi off the hanger for kappogi, and untie the collar straps.
Holding the collar straps, take the kappogi off the hanger for kappogi, and untie the collar straps.

sen.j: このとき割烹着の外側に素手や着物が触れないようにする。
sen.e: At this time, be careful that your bare hand or kimono doesn't touch the outside of the kappogi.
At this time, pay attention not your bare hand or kimono to touch the outside of the kappogi.
At this point, be careful that your bare hand does not touch the outside of the kappogi.
sen.cmt: 元に戻しました。At this time→At this point

sen.j: 割烹着を広げる。
sen.e: Unfold the kappogi.
Unfold the kappogi.
Unfold the kappogi.

sen.j: 割烹着の襟ヒモを持ってから、割烹着の外側だけに触れるようにして、袖山を滑らすように伸ばし、片方ずつ袖を通す。
sen.e: After holding the collar straps of the kappogi, being careful to touch only the outside of the kappogi, stretch the sleeve cap just like you make it slip, and let each arm pass through the sleeve one by one.
After holding the collar straps of the kappogi, carefully touch only the outside of the kappogi, stretch the sleeve cap smoothly, and let each arm pass through the sleeve one by one.

Holding the collar straps of the kappogi and being careful to touch only the outside of the kappogi, stretch the kappogi so that the upper part of the sleeves are smooth and then pass each arm through first one sleeve and then the other.

sen.j: このとき割烹着の外側に素手が触れないようにする。
sen.e: At this time, be careful that your bare hand doesn't touch the outside of the kappogi.
At this time, pay attention not your bare hand to touch the outside of the kappogi.
At this point, be careful that your bare hand does not touch the outside of the kappogi.
sen.cmt: 元に戻しました。At this time→At this point

sen.j: 手を袖から出す。
sen.e: Stick your hands out of the sleeves.
Stick the hands out of the sleeves.
Stick the hands out of the sleeves.

sen.j: 手が出にくい場合は、割烹着の内側から反対の袖を引き上げる。
sen.e: When it is hard to stick your hands out, pull up the opposite sleeve from the inside of the kappogi.
When it is hard to stick the hands out, pull up the opposite sleeve from the inside of the kappogi.
When it is hard to stick the hands out, pull up the opposite sleeve from the inside of the kappogi.

sen.j: 外に出た手で襟元を引っ張り、もう片方の手を出す。
sen.e: Pulling the collar with the hand which have come out of the sleeve, stick the other hand out.
Pulling the collar with the hand which have come out of the sleeve, stick the other hand out.
Pulling the collar with the hand which have come out of the sleeve, stick the other hand out.

sen.j: 襟ヒモを結ぶ。
sen.e: Tie the collar straps up.
Tie the collar straps up.
Tie the collar straps up.

sen.j: このとき割烹着の裏地の、着込んでいる着物の帯締めの位置に調節ヒモがある場合は調節ヒモを帯締めに結わえる。
sen.e: At this time, if an adjustable strap is attached to the lining of the kappogi, and its position is on the obijime (decorative string used to hold a kimono sash in place) of the kimono you wear, tie and fasten the adjustable strap to the obijime.

At this time, if an adjustable strap is attached to the lining of the kappogi, and its position is on the obijime (decorative string used to hold a kimono sash in place) of the kimono, tie and fasten the adjustable strap to the obijime.

At this time, if an adjustable strap is attached to the lining of the kappogi, and its position is on the obijime (decorative string used to hold a kimono sash in place) of the kimono, tie and fasten the adjustable strap to the obijime.

sen.j: 腰ヒモを後ろに回して前で結ぶ。
sen.e: Make the waist straps go around your back, and tie them at your front.
Make the waist straps go around the back, and tie them at the front.
Make the waist straps go around the back, and tie them at the front.

sen.j: このとき袖口がヒモの場合は腰ヒモの後に結ぶ。
sen.e: At this time, if straps are attached to the wrist openings of the sleeves, tie them after the waist straps.
At this time, if straps are attached to the wrist openings of the sleeves, tie them after the waist straps.
At this time, if straps are attached to the wrist openings of the sleeves, tie them after the waist straps.

sen.j: ここでは一般的に行われている、割烹着掛けに割烹着をかける手順の一例を示す。
sen.e: This section describes an example of common procedures for putting on kappogi over kimono.
sen.cmt: 原文はWebとExcelのいずれも「着物に割烹着をかける」となっているが、ここは割烹着の脱ぎ方の説明なので「割烹着掛けに割烹着をかける」（hanging kappogi on the hanger for kappogi) となるべきだと思われます。
sen.e: This section describes an example of common procedures for putting on kappogi over kimono.
This section describes an example of common procedures for hanging kappogi on the hanger for kappogi.
sen.cmt: 翻訳者のコメント通り、ここでは、「割烹着掛けに割烹着をかける」にならないと、下の説明と矛盾するため、原文をそのように書き換え、英文もそれに合わせて変えました。

sen.j: 腰ヒモを解き、手洗いをし、襟ヒモを解く。
sen.e: Untie the waist straps, wash your hands, and then untie the collar straps.
Untie the waist straps, wash the hands, and then untie the collar straps.
Untie the waist straps, wash the hands, and then untie the collar straps.

sen.j: 左手で割烹着の袖の内側を持ちながら右手を引く。
sen.e: Holding the inside of the sleeve of the kappogi with your left hand, pull your right hand.
Holding the inside of the sleeve of the kappogi with the left hand, pull the right hand.
Holding the inside of the sleeve of the kappogi with the left hand, pull the right hand.

sen.j: 割烹着の内側に入れた右手で左手の割烹着を押さえながら左手を割烹着から引いて脱ぐ。
sen.e: Holding the kappogi on your left hand with your right hand which you put into the inside of the kappogi, pull your left hand from the kappogi and take it off.
Holding the kappogi on the left hand with the right hand inside of the kappogi, pull the left hand from the kappogi and take it off.
sen.cmt: your → thewhich you put in the削除
sen.e: Holding the kappogi on the left hand with the right hand inside of the kappogi, pull the left hand from the kappogi and take it off.

sen.j: 割烹着が身体に触れないように離れて襟ヒモを持ち、襟元を合わせる。
sen.e: Keeping away from the kappogi so that it doesn't touch you body, hold the collar straps, and put the collars together.
Keeping away from the kappogi so that it doesn't touch the body, hold the collar straps, and put the collars together.
Keeping away from the kappogi so that it doesn't touch the body, hold the collar straps, and put the collars together.

sen.j: 襟ヒモを結び、内側が外になるようにして割烹着掛けに掛ける。
sen.e: Tie the collar straps, and making the inside of the kappogi outside, hang it on the hanger for kappogi.
Tie the collar straps, and making the inside of the kappogi outside, hang it on the hanger for kappogi.
Tie the collar straps, and making the inside of the kappogi outside, hang it on the hanger for kappogi.
